oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Union Capt. Edward Dale
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Writing his wife, Elizabeth, Capt. Dale talks of the winter flooding of the Tennessee River, pulling wagons through mud, and the songbirds. He is "in charge of the slaughtering and issuing of fresh beef" for troops in Chattanooga and speaks of the "great; loss sustained by the Govt. in this one item of consumption alone." Detailed description of Lookout Mountain and his plans to explore it.
